summary: Player home / Inn mod with separate storage for almost about everything. The title might explain a lot of things. Requires Dragonborn DLC
descriptionHtml:
Player home / Inn mod 

Recommended for people who:
spend way more time on sorting their things than they should
enjoy playing around with ragdolls and torturing people
have a thing for daedric artifacts
pick up every book they find
want to be able to shout and jump around inside the house without messing clutter up (disabled havok on a lot of things (one by one yes)

How to:
1. Find a courier, receiv note
2. Get there, enter the house, save the game, load it, leave the house, re-enter the house (to prevent mannequins from doing mannequin things)
3. Talk to Peter File and ask him about the great source of fun

Storage: 
Separate, scripted storage for armor, clothes, robes, one-handed weapons, two-handed weapons, bows, ammo, staffs, tools, shields, necklaces, circlets, rings, empty/filled soulgems, ingredients, health potions, stamina potions, magicka potions, poisons, pelts, leather thingies, ores, ingots, gemstones, food, food ingredients, drinks, books, journals, scrolls, spellbooks 

3 Mannequins + a few more in convenient places like right next to the anvil 
Loads of weapon/shield racks and displays
A chest to store stuff you\'d want to sell sometime later 
An entire room for all your Daedric artifacts and books about daedra stuff
Bookshelves

In the torture room, you can: 
swim in cabbages 
invite followers, lock them up and burn them alive or let the dwarven thresher stroke them to death 
torture this lady that\'s really nice to you for some reason 
do whatever you want to the corpses that were already there 
try to hit the cabbages into the crypts using the thresher and your mad timing skills

NPCs 
aren\'t impressed by your jokes 
sometimes talk to eachother 
sell/buy stuff 
annoy you with music 
beg for gold 

Also:
-there\'s a light switch that changes the lighting in the inn from fabulous to boring
-I completely removed a POI with useless bandits
-Not lore friendly at all
-I recommend using unlimited bookshelves, cause it\'s really awesome
-the horse thingy outside is working
-the bedroom happens to have shackles :>

Requires dragonborn (I\'m sorry) 

Location: SW of Helgen 

Known issues: 
mannequins sometimes creep on you 
the torches outside don\'t make sense 
there\'s no smelter 
if you spawn too many cabbages and jump in it, you might squeeze through the floor, there\'s probably no way to fix this
author: luul
